inference:
The sum of the angles in a triangle is 180 degrees, so
$$30^\circ + 2x + x = 180^\circ$$

$$\Rightarrow 3x = 180^\circ-30^\circ$$

$$x = \frac{180^\circ-30^\circ}{3} = \frac{150^\circ}{3} = \boxed{50^\circ}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$50^\circ$}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: The angles of a triangle sum to $180^\circ$, so we have $x + 2x + 30^\circ = 180^\circ$.  Simplifying gives $3x +30^\circ = 180^\circ$, so $3x =150^\circ$ and $x = \boxed{50^\circ}$.
